intro: Melandrium kialense, commonly known as the Kiala catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as carnations and moss campion. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Melandrium kialense is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and open habitats.
